sw

Class DirectoryCrawler.Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.File
      • sw.DirectoryCrawler.Directory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.io.File>
    Enclosing class:
    DirectoryCrawler

    private class DirectoryCrawler.Directory
extends java.io.File
    This class organises the directories in a tree-like structure, where each directory/sub-directories and files are nodes. Directories have children, where files are leaf nodes (no children).
    Version:
    Insight Data Engineering NY, September-October 2015
    Author:
    Elizabeth Fong

      Returns true if this directory has a next file, false otherwise.

      • Directory

        private Directory(java.lang.String path,
                  DirectoryCrawler.Directory parent)
        Constructor. Creates a node, given the path to the file/directory and the parent node.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to this file/directory.
        parent - The parent directory.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        private boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if this directory has a next file, false otherwise. This method moves the pointer to the next file.
        Returns:
        true if this directory has a next file, false otherwise.

        private java.io.File next()
        Returns the next file in the directory.
